title: Chile elects far-right José Antonio Kast as next president
snippet: He will be inaugurated on 11 March 2026. At rallies, he regularly counted down the days until this date warning undocumented immigrants that they should leave before then if they ever want the chance to return.

title: Kast’s Victory in Chile Is Another Win for Global Right-Wing Movement - The New York Times
snippet: José Antonio Kast had seen it coming. “Our ideas already won — they won in the United States, they won in Italy and they won in Argentina,” he said on Chilean radio one day after President Trump’s inauguration in January.

title: José Antonio Kast - Wikipedia
snippet: José Antonio Kast Rist (born 18 January 1966), also known by his initials JAK, is a Chilean lawyer and politician.

title: Ultra-conservative José Antonio Kast elected Chile’s next president | Chile | The Guardian
snippet: The son of a Nazi party member and an admirer of Pinochet, Kast built his campaign on a promise to expel tens of thousands of undocumented migrants ... The ultra-conservative former congressman José Antonio Kast has been elected as Chile’s next president.

title: Chile Turns Hard To The Right: José Antonio Kast Easily Wins Presidency | The Liberty Beacon
snippet: Kast will take office in March. Guiding off the inauguration date, he has repeatedly warned illegals of how many days they to self-deport, before his administration kicks them out.
